text: How much would you pay for advice from actress Emma Watson? Commuters and travelers
at New York's Grand Central Station found out on February 14. American writer
Derek Blasberg carried a tray holding an iPad from which the actress appeared to be
live-streaming. The sign attached to the tray said, "Advice from Emma Watson, $2."
Fans flocked to social media to post videos of people at the station getting advice from
Emma. The actress grew to stardom for her role as Hermione Granger in the Harry Potter
movie series. While neither Watson nor Blasberg publicized the event on social media,
some have speculated that the impromptu advice session might have ties to Emma's leading
role in an upcoming science fiction thriller movie called "The Circle." Watson is also set
to star as Belle in the upcoming live-action remake of Disney's "Beauty and the Beast."
For NewsBeat Social, I'm Matt Paul.
